string-array.name: m_e_Array
string-array.item: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ (١) ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ (٢) لَمۡ يَلِدۡ وَلَمۡ يُولَدۡ (٣) وَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُ ۥ ڪُفُوًا أَحَدٌ (٤)
Qul huwal laahu ahad Allah hus-samad Lam yalid wa lam yoolad Wa lam yakul-lahu kufuwan ahad
Whoever recites (Three Qul) three times in the evening and in the morning will protect you against everything.[Narrated by al-Tirmidhi, al-Da’waat, 3499, Sunan al-Tirmidhi, no. 2829]
قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡفَلَقِ ( ١ ) مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ ( ٢ ) وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ ( ٣ ) وَمِن شَرِّ ٱلنَّفَّـٰثَـٰتِ فِى ٱلۡعُقَدِ ( ٤ ) وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ ( ٥ )
Qul auzoo bi rabbil-falaq Min sharri ma khalaq Wa min sharri ghasiqin iza waqab Wa min sharrin-naffaa-saati fil uqad Wa min shar ri haasidin iza hasad
Whoever recites (Three Qul) three times in the evening and in the morning will protect you against everything.[Narrated by al-Tirmidhi, al-Da’waat, 3499, Sunan al-Tirmidhi, no. 2829]

قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلنَّاسِ ( ١ ) مَلِكِ النَّاسِ ( ٢ ) إِلَـٰهِ ٱلنَّاسِ ( ٣ ) مِن شَرِّ ٱلۡوَسۡوَاسِ ٱلۡخَنَّاسِ ( ٤ ) ٱلَّذِى يُوَسۡوِسُ فِى صُدُورِ ٱلنَّاسِ ( ٥ ) مِنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ ( ٦ )
Qul a'uzu birabbin naas Malikin naas Ilaahin naas Min sharril was waasil khannaas Al lazee yuwas wisu fee sudoorin naas Minal jinnati wan naas

Say: I seek refuge with the Lord and Cherisher of Mankind, The King (or Ruler) of Mankind, The Allah (for judge) of Mankind,- From the mischief of the Whisperer (of Evil), who withdraws (after his whisper),- (The same) who whispers into the hearts of Mankind,- Among Jinns and among men.
Whoever recites (Three Qul) three times in the evening and in the morning will protect you against everything.[Narrated by al-Tirmidhi, al-Da’waat, 3499, Sunan al-Tirmidhi, no. 2829]
